title: 12 Tips to Get a Picture Perfect Smile

steps.title: Lift your eyes and cheekbones to make your smile more genuine.
steps.content: Lift your eyes and cheekbones to make your smile more genuine. According to modeling agent Traci Halvorson, the key to a beautiful smile is to “be alive in your eyes.” [1] X Expert Source Traci Halvorson Modeling Agent Expert Interview. 28 May 2021. Start with a relaxed face, then squint slightly to lift the corners of your eyes. Follow up by lifting the corners of your mouth to smize . You’ll know you’re doing it right if you cover your mouth and it still looks like you’re smiling. [2] X Research source Smiling with your eyes is also known as the Duchenne smile. It involves contracting the muscles around your cheekbones and upper lip to create a beautiful, genuine smile. [3] X Research source Narrowing your eyes might seem counterintuitive to a good smile, but it actually isn’t! Believe it or not, widening your eyes too much can make you look fearful and unapproachable.

steps.title: A funny memory can help your smile look more friendly and natural.
steps.content: A funny memory can help your smile look more friendly and natural. Think about the last time you were laughing with a friend or cracking up at your favorite TV show. Chances are, that smile lit up your whole face—your eyes were crinkling, your cheekbones were lifted, and those telltale smile lines were curving from your nose to your lips. Picture that same funny moment whenever you’re about to take a picture. You'll end up with a smile that’s beautiful and authentic. [4] X Research source On the flip side, look up a picture of two celebrities or politicians meeting on camera. Their smiles are probably tense, forced, and the exact opposite of what you want to go for.

steps.title: Keep your camera above eye level to avoid any unflattering angles.
steps.content: Keep your camera above eye level to avoid any unflattering angles. According to professional photographer Crystal Bear, you can take better photos by “facing a window with your [camera] just slightly above eye level and looking down at you.” [5] X Expert Source Crystal Bear Professional Photographer Expert Interview. 21 January 2021. This will help your chin look thinner, plus prevent the camera from distorting your facial features. It’s a small trick that can make your smile appear much brighter on camera! If you’re taking a selfie, Bear recommends using the back camera on your phone and “putting it on a tripod.” [6] X Expert Source Crystal Bear Professional Photographer Expert Interview. 21 January 2021. Whatever you do, don’t hold the camera below your eyeline. This upward angle shows off your nose and chin more than your stunning smile, which you definitely don’t want!

steps.title: Don’t let your top and bottom teeth touch each other when smiling.
steps.content: Don’t let your top and bottom teeth touch each other when smiling. Leave a tiny gap of space between your upper and lower rows of teeth for a natural smile. Clenching your teeth together can cause muscle tension and make you look uncomfortable. In fact, your teeth should only touch when swallowing for proper jaw position. [7] X Research source Practice smiling with your teeth slightly separated in the mirror, then smile with your teeth touching. You’ll be able to see the difference!

steps.title: Some people find big, V-shaped smiles less attractive and photogenic.
steps.content: Some people find big, V-shaped smiles less attractive and photogenic. According to research, smaller smiles with a medium mouth angle are considered more attractive than huge, toothy smiles with a high, V-shaped angle. [8] X Trustworthy Source PLOS ONE Online peer-reviewed, open access scientific research journal Go to source Keep your smile natural instead of over-exaggerating it—you’ll be surprised at how much of a difference it makes! This isn’t to say that toothy smiles are totally off-limits! Showing a little teeth is fine, as long as you’re not forcing a huge grin. Focus on lifting your cheekbones, slightly squinting your eyes, and keeping your jaw relaxed. These are all key elements of a natural smile!

steps.title: Wetting your teeth with your tongue can add some shine to your smile.
steps.content: Wetting your teeth with your tongue can add some shine to your smile. As you’re getting in position for your photo, quickly slide your tongue over your upper and lower rows of teeth. A quick coat of saliva helps your teeth look bright and polished, which takes your smile to new, beautiful heights. Petroleum jelly can also do the trick—just rub a little bit over the front of your teeth to give them an extra sheen. Just be sure not to swallow it!

steps.title: A bright, symmetrical smile looks more genuine than an asymmetrical one.
steps.content: A bright, symmetrical smile looks more genuine than an asymmetrical one. Studies show that people associate symmetrical smiles with beauty and attractiveness. [9] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source More often than not, cheeky, sideways smiles are linked to sarcasm, rather than genuine happiness. So, try to smile with your face fully and evenly pointed forward—that way, there’s no room for doubt that your beautiful smile is genuine. To fix an uneven smile , try chewing on both sides of your mouth and sleeping on both sides evenly. You can also perform facial exercises, like practicing a fish face or holding a pencil in your mouth, to strengthen your jaw muscles. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Maintain good posture to increase your overall attractiveness.
steps.content: Maintain good posture to increase your overall attractiveness. Instead of crossing your arms in front of your chest, stand up straight , pull your shoulders back, and raise your chin. Proper posture improves your health and self-confidence, causing others to perceive you as more attractive, too. [11] X Research source The more approachable you look, the more genuine and beautiful your smile will seem. Try lifting up your chest a little bit and leaning forward slightly during your next conversation. This posture will make you look even more friendly and engaged.

steps.title: It’s easier to perfect your smile when you can see it head-on.
steps.content: It’s easier to perfect your smile when you can see it head-on. Memorize exactly what the smile feels like—what muscles are you using? What makes this smile different from all of the others? The more you practice in front of a mirror, the easier it will be to produce a natural-looking smile on the spot. [12] X Research source It can help to take a look at an old selfie where you’re busting out a beautiful grin, or to google pictures of happy-looking people. Take a close look at their expressions and try to copy exactly what they’re doing. It may seem silly at first, but it’s a great way to master a beautiful smile! [13] X Research source

steps.title: Smooth, luscious lips are an important part of a beautiful smile.
steps.content: Smooth, luscious lips are an important part of a beautiful smile. If your lips are on the chapped side, swipe on some healing and moisturizing lip balm . Look for hypoallergenic and fragrance-free products with ingredients like castor seed oil, ceramides, shea butter, petrolatum, mineral oil, dimethicone, hemp seed oil, and/or white petroleum jelly. [14] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Apply the balm throughout the day to keep your lips (and smile!) looking gorgeous. If you like, apply lipstick . Studies show darker shades can make women look more attractive and feminine. [15] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source As tough as it may be, try not to pick or bite at your lips when they’re chapped. This will only make things worse! [16] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: The most beautiful smile of all is a healthy one.
steps.content: The most beautiful smile of all is a healthy one. According to board-certified dentist and oral surgeon Pradeep Adatrow, DDS, MS, you should “ brush your teeth twice daily with a soft-bristle toothbrush.” Make sure to “use dental floss to clean the spaces between your teeth.” [17] X Expert Source Pradeep Adatrow, DDS, MS Board Certified Dentist & Oral Surgeon Expert Interview. 20 September 2023. To maintain a beautiful smile, visit your dentist twice a year for cleanings and cavity prevention. [18] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Here are some other easy ways to keep your teeth in great shape: Cut back on sweet, sugary treats. Steer clear of cigarettes and chewing tobacco. Buy a new toothbrush every 3-4 months, or whenever the bristles are worn out. Use toothpaste , mouthwash , and other oral care products endorsed by the American Dental Association .

steps.title: Bright pearly whites can enhance your natural smile.
steps.content: Bright pearly whites can enhance your natural smile. There are tons of teeth-whitening products on the market, so start with a whitening toothpaste and see how that works for you. For faster results, use whitening strips or whitening gels . They usually have higher concentrations of hydrogen peroxide to lighten your teeth. [19] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You can also try toothpaste with baking soda or whitening trays to whiten your teeth at home. If you have sensitive teeth, talk with your dentist before trying any at-home whitening products. They can tell you which products work best for you and offer other suggestions. To get the best results from whitening strips, licensed dentist Lewis Chen, DDS, FICOI, FIADFE says to make sure you “don’t apply it to the gums” and ensure your “teeth are dry prior to application.” [20] X Expert Source Lewis Chen, DDS, FICOI, FIADFE Licensed Dentist Expert Interview. 11 May 2021.
